DataElement.preferredName: Prior Melanoma Radiation Therapy Radiation Field Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of a radiation field used deliver treatment to site(s) of melanoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Melanoma Radiation Therapy Radiation Field
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prior RT administered._The reason of something._A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

Concepts.definition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.
